title: Hot Springs boy, 17, dies in accidental shooting
content:
MARSHALL – A 17-year-old Hot Springs boy died Saturday in what investigators say was an accidental shooting.
Joshua Timothy Henderson died Saturday afternoon after suffering a shotgun blast, Madison County Sheriff’s Office chief deputy Michael Garrison said.
Henderson and a friend were preparing to go hunting when the accident happened at about 1:20 p.m. Saturday, Garrison said.
According to the friend’s statement to investigators, the boys were in the carport of Henderson’s home at 1180 Grassy Creek Road when Henderson tripped and fell and a shotgun he was holding discharged, Garrison said. Henderson was struck in the head.
An autopsy was planned Monday, Garrison said.
“We don’t suspect any foul play,” he said. “It’s a tragedy for the family and the community.”
The SBI is assisting in the investigation.
Henderson was an avid skateboarder and over the last few years sought to get a skate park built in Hot Springs, Sheriff Buddy Harwood said.
“He was just a real personable kind of kid, very kind-hearted,” Harwood said.
Henderson had been a senior at Madison High School but had left the school recently to seek his GED.
Madison Funeral Home will be assisting the family, but arrangements have not been completed.
Editor’s note: News-Record & Sentinel staff writer Melissa Dean contributed to this report.
